pbn3mS8WkiipEnoDw0UzKQ.text: I went here for breakfast. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. Very clean, cool atmosphere, rnb music playing. Banana split waffles are delicious. Waffle fries, seasoned potatoes, smoothie and coffee were all very good. The eggs were sooooo gross. Order anything but those weird textured, non-flavorful eggs. Janine have us very good service. We'll be back to try more stuff.

DnAjC0XDOzlKNjBoylms2Q.text: This has become one of our favorite places!!! I try a different menu every time and have yet to be dissatisfied!! And to think so found waffles cafe because I was craving boba!! Which even their boba is so good! The buffalo waffle sandwich is my fave though!

72C1-Iw930U-p0p17Fl9lg.text: Love this place. Great for a change up for breakfast/brunch, family friendly and even when busy doesn't take forever to get food or a table.

ptZVtz5gAmyzRXLes2-Y0A.text: I rarely give any place 5 stars, but we tried this for the first time.   We are from out of town, but come out a few times a year.  They were busy, so that alone told me it should be good.  We waited for our order, it didn't seem like a very long wait at all, when the owner, Kim came out to apologize because apparently our order slip fell and no one saw it til the owner picked it up.  Anyway, Kim comp our meal AND gave us a coupon towards our next visit.  The food is amazing!!! Thank you Kim! You are a very generous owner.  Your staff is very friendly, and well, once again.....your food is AMAZING!!! We will definitely be back!!!

MhTWlV6s1JQN5kWXlSWQnQ.text: I would go back for the waffle sandwich and for the guy that took our order, but both orders of our regular waffles were hard, dry, and cold. Some of the side options, like sausage, are a little overpriced for the amount of food that you get.

KAstD7wCUPcCkgyJG1vJwA.text: Love the food and service very unique experience and taste always have friendly service and the staff hives great recommendations on choices. Red Velvet waffles are my daughters favr

FVw6eH3Tk8eoM3-Lf3xtIw.text: The waffles were cooked perfectly, the girl behind the counter came out and explained the menu very thorough. Fresh fruit bowl with turkey bacon accompanied my pumpkin waffle drizzled with pecan syrup. Good food overall at a decent price.

iHqjk-0_jZ-Cb4cc34vgcA.text: Out with my kids and decided to get some late breakfast this morning. I've seen Waffles Cafe before and been curious about the food/concept. Our experience was pretty mixed. Cons: menu is confusing and "building your own combo" takes a hot minute to figure out. Are we in a Boba place or a milkshake place or a Waffle place? Are we better at breakfast or lunch? Slightly confusing.  Bathroom is dingy, maybe just unkept?, and waffle wasn't hot when served (butter-didn't-melt unhot). Brand feels a little confused somewhere between fast food and mom and pop diner. Fancy waffle around $7-$9 (for just the waffle). Syrup was thin and sweet, not very maple-y, as I had hoped for a waffle place. If you just order a simple waffle with syrup, I think you'd be disappointed. Pros: fruit bowl came with fresh mangos, pineapples and blueberries (amazing fruit bowl). Sandwiches and kids meal come with side/drink. "Coffee bar" and hot sauce bar had nice assortment. Most enjoyable was A.J. She greeted us, took our order and was incredibly friendly and informative. She saved our experience, which dependent on the food/cost, wasn't overly impressive.  We ordered mostly breakfast items and if we were to return might try the lunch/brunch items. I have a feeling those might be stronger than the breakfast items we ordered.

TwN2qGqApUj1LZ4RSilIgA.text: Food was good but service wasn't the best. We ordered our food and that came pretty quick. They forgot our drinks and my husband let the girl at the register know. She said they were behind and she will give us our drinks when she can. There were only 2 people sitting down, beside us. There were more people working in the back, and if you can't take care of your current customers, you shouldn't take in more customers.

K6yhpPU4heqg2Tmbk3i_gg.text: Great service with a smile! I enjoy all the waffle combinations but my favorite here is the potato scramble. Great place to eat and bring the family

LpNDkvAg0ODL9Xh0wtc-zQ.text: We love this cafe! The waffles are amazing. The potatoes were a favorite. They have a large variety of choices and everything we have tried was great. The service is wonderful and all of the employees are polite and attentive. Our new favorite breakfast destination.

BJy5Ubi0QJkdMx3dRdqDZA.text: A MUST TRY!! Delish  I'm a foodie while traveling I like to get on yelp and explore restaurants well this dive is excellent. Inexpensive and the paper plates and utensils well are a good thing if you're a germaphobe. Back the food I asked for eggs over medium, bacon waffle with ice cream, whip cream, strawberries, bananas, & pecans 5* from the crunchy bacon to the perfect waffle oh and the mango smoothly was to die for.  ~from a full tummy and my overjoyed palette :)

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles Cafe - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

GSJcMDVgMm1Ppy7OzOXGcA.text: I was really disappointed in this place since it has such great reviews. I ordered a plain waffle, bacon, and a hash brown. They were all terrible. The bacon was so burnt I wouldn't even give it to my dog. Nevermind that everything had a sort of medal taste to it. I don't know how they cook the hash browns but it had the weirdest flavor. While the waffle was light and crunchy, it also had a weird taste of aluminum. I don't know what caused the flavor, but I suggest they by better ingredients and clean their cooking mediums. Could not eat any of the food.

N4aFAFxKn4x2sIG1YKJ78w.text: I'd say the food is 3/5, but w/ cheap prices, I'd bump it to 4 stars.  I came for breakfast on a Sunday morning.  The store specializes in Waffle entrees like waffle pancakes & waffle sandwiches.  They also serve boba and various teas.  The food is pretty good and relatively cheap for $6.  I was expecting it to be $8 but for $6 I can't really complain.  If they raised the prices I might go someplace else.  Breakfast waffle - decent 3/5 - $6.  Comes w/ bacon, ham, egg, and served on a waffle w/ syrup inside.  Also comes w/ a side of chips. -The breakfast waffle is pretty good.  It's really hard to mess up breakfast entrees but this tasted decent.  If you don't like sweet foods I'd recommend getting syrup on the side.  TIPS: -All entrees are served on paper plates (from Costco) & plastic utensils.  Blegh.   -Water is self serve but it tasted a bit odd when I tried it.  I got an OJ instead

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles Cafe - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast waffle $6

xQQp78XW_DYW9M-XM-Fy1w.text: I cannot say enough good things about this place! The customer service is too notch! You're greeted upon walking in. The food is amazing! I am in love with this cafe ! Do yourself a favor and try it. Also if you have the pleasure of meeting one of the employees by the name of Ashar just know you will be well taken care of and have a great experience.

a9iZ_uQyic0BNmLWluteBg.text: One of my favorite spots to eat breakfast! The owners are so polite as well!! They hired more staff and all we have come across have been amazing and so nice!! Love this place

_3ndkmvAXHHo_md9NTbMsg.text: Waffles with bananas and peanut butter, you just can't beat it!  Prices were very reasonable too! A great little place to grab some breakfast!

CcC1PzraArIDXRKsFxlO1w.text: The Thai tea was terrible!! It was super watery and had absolutely no flavor . My mom got the milk tea and it was literally sour and after an hour it started separating . My aunts and uncles all got the taro slush, it wasn't as bad and the flavor was kinda nice, but not ONE drink had nice and chewy boba balls. All of the boba balls were hard on the inside and tasted like starch.

xWcEdHtiY-ERMbjqya88ug.text: I've passed by this place probably a hundred times. Not sure why I never stopped. My wife and I decided to give it a try and we weren't disappointed. She got the breakfast sandwich and I got the buffalo chicken sandwich. They both came on a waffle. You get to choose from chips, hash brown, of waffle fries. Get the waffle fries. Then they have like 7 or 8 seasonings you can have. I tried the salt & vinegar. Was pretty amazing.   There was so many options so we will be back for another go. Especially for happy hour to try one of there shakes.

vJoJHUURKXG9y1pfEEPp1g.text: I absolutely love Waffles! So it was a no-brainer to check this place out. Cute concept. Waffles with just about any topping and filling (turkey & cheese, sandwich waffle)  you can think up. They even offer boba which is hard to find in North Las Vegas so that's was cool.   Unfortunately the waffles were just OK, they definitely weren't the best I've ever had. But my kids loved it so we'll be back! I guess I was expecting more from a place called Waffles Cafe. Another thing to mention, the customer service has always been outstanding, keep up the good work!

yExPw-lDx5ukFVlRLY9vKw.text: Good place for breakfast or lunch.  Kids love the kids breakfast.  I've had the adult breakfast and chicken and waffles,  both good. Friendly staff. Lots of choices.

zwyPElEpIn8nRkPSuw4H0A.text: One word, YUM! I really wasn't expecting much of this cafe honesty, but it's fantastic. The cafe itself is so cute with names printed out and stuck on the walls, and the posters all around. Gives a super positive vibe. The waffles taste so good! I had an original waffle with strawberries, caramel sauce, whipped cream and powdered sugar (which by the way I recommend!) the waffle was cooked perfectly and the strawberries were so fresh. The only thing I'd like to see different would be proper plates/knives/forks (not plastic and paper). Other than that I highly recommend!

LkIWd7JfjnvkrfntuSpP3Q.text: The food is good but not worth the wait. You guys need to seriously fix this part of your business.

mCRIou-3faiYc2Hu7y_PAA.text: I like this place. If you're in the mood for Waffles, I encourage you to stop by.

h5XZpPTY6c7xlMkAJ_MAbw.text: Great food. Had a turkey waffle sandwhich.  Place is clean, staff is friendly, food came quickly. No problems. Will go back. They also have ice cream served in .....waffle cones.

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles Cafe - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

if4hUcyvoIEyoDEJEFRbVg.text: Perfect place for a nice friendly breakfast either on a date or with family. The staff are all smiles and enjoy the environment of this little cafe as well. The food is creative and delicious!

12yQhYPhJ3BhTGc96SoV2A.text: The service is outstanding, and I love all the different toppings! The lime infused water was a nice touch, too. Will definitely go again!

bkiYkySJiDmxGk4X-macSg.text: Good food, but I prefer eating on real plates and drinking coffee out of a mug as opposed to having everything be cheap styrofoam.  The food is excellent and the prices too, but if there is one thing I don't like while eating at a restaurant, it's eating my meal as if I were out camping somewhere & had no real silverware.  Eaten here once and would love to make regular trips if they had real plates, especially to go with their waffles.

cIWM41_GJuEvwSYKK_jKMQ.text: A great lil joint. Awesome people always smiling and making sure they get ur meal/drink just perfect. I went in there to order something but they had never made it the way I tried it years back in a diff state but that didn't stop them, they wanted to create it for me and they did. Great service

dnftGGAyrvZCK9jaPhYFCw.text: Waffles were tasty.  If you build your own it can get a bit pricey.  Ambience is cute.  This neighborhood needs places like this.

obl4iWJkQFBogDzz1sYLpA.text: I got a lot of hype about this place and it was good. It was not the best ever like a lot of people told me but, I will again for a second opinion. I had the Jimi's waffle and it was tasty. Kinda expensive and I hate paper plates and plastic untensils for things I have to cut.

z1SJr96AGTKNtGkoBNA4NA.text: If you are looking for a great breakfast waffle with delicious side items then rhis isn't the place. The food is terrible. ..no flavor and nothing special. Taste and looks like it was microwaved. If u listen closely tou will hear a bell ding going off ever so often. Thats the microwave.  The Columbian coffee taste watered down. Maxwell's House coffee would be an improvement. Dont waste your money and dont get fooled by the name of the joint. Pedestrian food and service at best.

iaxDBX9NKCxFKo7sS_wZKg.text: I went here afte checking the reviews and it was close. This place is ok I usually give spots another chance so I will update soon but for now I really wasnt amazed. I had a waffle breakfast sandwich and it tasted like something i couldve made at home.

Xavr4EMHIam_7eIE_WNg-w.text: Wonderful food!  If your near North Las Vegas you need to stop here!  Highly recommended to all!

StN0GdGVrHiBz9T7tba84g.text: The pricing was very high for a plain waffle. The food was served on paper plates with plastic utensils. Definitely not impressed with the service. I would save your $20 and get breakfast elsewhere.

1Fh6vNEK3tvzibf7pisG4Q.text: The waffles are great, but you have to try the tuna sandwich where they use waffles as the bread! On top of that, their bobs teas hit the spot.

iQy5qrnK_RvpbCRgCo_E2w.text: This place was excellent. I had the breakfast combo (coffee, 2 eggs, sausage patty, and a huge waffle) and was satisfied . The food was delicious and the restaurant was clean.

YIVzpsKjOnsLV9Y12pfcWw.text: I love their waffle breakfast sandwich! In my opinion it's the only thing good here. I've been here a lot and have really tried to love this place but After trying most of the menu the food really isn't that good. They are friendly and fast service but nothing is really that tasty. The bacon seems to be precooked and just reheated which tastes fine in the sandwich but not on it's own. The hash brown is like the frozen patties you buy and just deep fry- nothing special. The eggs are fluffy and perhaps poured from a carton and on the mushy side but again, in the sandwich they're good but we ordered a side of them and it was mushy. The waffles are average but the breakfast sandwich is where it's at. It comes with potato chips on the side which is interesting but I love the sweet sauce in the sandwich followed by the salty chips. I can't see myself going back here for anything else. If they ever took it off the menu I would probably never come back. They get 3 stars- 1 for friendly service, 1 for quick service, and 1 for the breakfast sandwich.

VG4sCV3aXHZ8vIlvVu5BNA.text: We will be going here often.  Plenty of choices, both sweet and savory, modest and indulgent. The owner (or manager maybe) was delightfully friendly and accommodating.  The spicy sauce that comes with the chicken & waffle is addictive.

6AQHt9P9Qli232KUsG3F5A.text: one star because its required.  this place is SUCH a let down.  im not sure how the overall rating of this place is so high.  but to each their own i guess.  the waffles are crisp and then all air once you start eating. no flavor at all.  addons are a buck a piece (strawberries, cherry pie filling, etc.) which is a little much in my opinion but alright. you get unlimited coffee, which we had too wait for twice because they ran out. in my opinion they should keep up on that especially around breakfast time. also,if you add 'hashbrowns' its a buck for a hashbrown that mcdonalds serves. seriously?  they serve you on styrafoam and make you eat with plastic utensils.  they also dont know how to cook eggs over medium. so if that is how you like them, order them medium well and maybe theyll get it correctly.  if their quality of food was better, the concept of the place would work out well.  this place is pathetic. waffles at ihop are way more impressive.

IgIQFygI2o9vLqtXcFtoRw.text: Love this place. Sauce is reallly good and the service is usually fast and friendly. Been goung for awhile now since the waffles and chicken is so good.

Qz3dyolxAy7k9Qiowd437Q.text: These photos do not do it justice! This food was amazing, from the waffle breakfast sandwich that melts in your mouth to the best peanut butter chocolate shake i have ever tasted. Kimmy our server/the owner is the absolute best. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles Cafe - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

wxor2PTU5Y08cSTofTe0kA.text: LOVE this place, the atmosphere, customer service and most of all FOOD! Both of my kids love it as well! Definitely a place for Sunday Brunches!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles Cafe - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

S0lV3VMPxCKJHjGmsH7vHg.text: OMG I'm in love! The chicken and waffles are my favorite! Wish I could give 10 stars. I get them with extra strawberries and extra buffalo sauce (bc I like it spicy) and chop everything up so every bite is the perfect bite! Yummmm My husband loves it just the way it comes and laughs at me for pre cutting everything before I eat. Lol Love the smoothies too! I get honeydew+ strawberry pearls and he gets honeydew+pineapple+ strawberry pearls and they so delicious!  If you haven't tried this place, do it! It's great anytime of the day!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles Cafe - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute decor
Photo of Waffles Cafe - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped up Chicken and Waffles! Best in the world!

qMuAUlT7ytzbOUioRv4iJQ.text: Found this little Gem and loved it! The staff was very friendly and food was great. Food was great and plenty of it. The staff refilled our drinks fast we never saw an empty glass. Would definitely recommend this place!

7umG8TtoC03T2yklHiAQxg.text: I tried this place for the first time days ago.  Im not a big waffle fan but this place won me over.  I had the chicken and waffle and a chocolate milk shake. I know what a funky combination.  All of it was sooo good. Chicken cooked perfectly and the waffle was great.  I look forward to going back to this place.  The price point is good for a small location..

AoWksfcZ8oiEIpLTWTWY7w.text: I'm just waited 30 minutes for a Hawaiian pizza and a grilled chicken sandwich. And the place is empty. As soon as I walked up and asked for refund the pizza and chicken sandwich was ready. The person that ordered after me got their food before me and ordered a lot more. Ridiculous. Order at 11:04 am was brought out at 11:32 Am

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles Cafe - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. And I also tipped them....

8eSQczOr0ZKSxWC10m8w3A.text: Outstanding food.  A must go to if you are in this area.  Great staff, good food, good location

C6K0bn5fVesLWOgXRh239A.text: A little family owned specialty waffle spot located by the Smith's in Aliante. Personally have never tried any of their food items, but I have heard people say, "Order anything, because everything there is delicious!" We've become regulars to this place for their boba drinks though.   FOR HER: I opt for the FRUIT SMOOTHIES -- lychee is my personal favorite. Honey dew or cantaloupe as a tied second. I add boba to it (additional $0.30 charge).   FOR HIM: He loves the ORIGINAL BOBA TEAS -- the milk one being his favorite. Comes with boba too! He also is a fan of the chocolate smoothie, but does not feel it pairs well with boba.  TIP: They offer happy hour from 2pm-6pm, where drinks are buy one, get one half off which makes it super worth it! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles Cafe - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate &amp; honeydew smoothies with boba.
Photo of Waffles Cafe - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lychee fruit smoothie with boba (LEFT) &amp; milk tea (RIGHT).

e79vT7kPirU2NmbxGqUY4Q.text: When I lived in Aliante this place was my go to for boba tea since other places are quite a drive. I'm glad that their boba tea menu fits my cravings (for more simplistic drinks) especially their milk tea or the lychee smoothie with boba/lychee jelly.   I've had their waffles a couple of times and they're decent. I never make waffles nor do I have anything to make waffles with so this is good when I want it once in a while. I'm partial to sweet versus savory. They do have normal breakfast options if you just want waffles on the side and not dressed up.  Their coffee drinks are also really good!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles Cafe - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beverages
Photo of Waffles Cafe - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their newer menu

j7UuLaeHurG0q1tkPGurDg.text: This place is very tasty- so many options you will change your mind every time you think you made a decision.  I built my own meal - got the Red Velvet waffle - tasted very Red Velvety- it came with a cream cheese icing - I could have eaten that by as is but i decided to add some strawberries and whipped cream - YUM!!!  The fruit is very fresh - i did not receive one overly bitter piece of fruit.  There were so many options to try! You cant go wrong!

photos.caption: Photo of Waffles Cafe - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet waffle with strawberries &amp; whipped cream. Side of fruit &amp;over easy eggs

pbY3_wsddit9EBFV5SdbwA.text: Nice little place. Good service, better than average food, Seems pretty busy for s Sunday early morning. Big menu so everyone can find something.  If you are looking for a full service breakfast place go somewhere else. This is fast food breakfast and waffles are the star. Nice job.

x4OLvMeR8gzCa7pq5en91w.text: Had the Best friend waffle and was undercooked. Mentioned it to the staff the where kind and offered a refund right away. I said wow you sound like this happens often, unhappy clients. She said yes it does. I asked her about the reviews, she said family and laughed.

Y0ZXK5OnsTunbiqnscFXEg.text: One of our fave breakfast spots in Vegas. Their kind employees and awesome food has us coming back almost every Sunday!!! Chicken and waffles are always hot and tasty. Thank you guys for providing such an amazing restaurant!

Q-h6GkbUDJ0BTjEP_EhnSg.text: Hot. Fresh. made to order. Delicious. If you are in Vegas, you have to stop at this place. Wonderful service. And the food, wings were crisp. Waffle was warm and soft. The strawberry whipped butter !!!!! So good. The grits, I couldn't believe these weren't southern grits, so yummy! I will often dream of this place after I return home, it is that good!

m2NsS0ytER7EATo5kI-qhA.text: Only reason I am giving it 2 stars is because the delivery driver was on time and very nice. The food was not good at all.. waffle was super soggy, sausage was like rubber and potatoes was just regular fried potatoes nothing special to them at all.

apsC_U2fJxN9qoX9cQssRQ.text: Jainie is such a friendly employee! Very nice. Even when there were no other customers, she kept busy by cleaning the tables and making sure nothing was on the floor. I love coming here. The environment is always cheerful and the food is awesome.

C5Cv_t3CqJIIYHieF78eEA.text: We got the potato scramble, tornado fries, the blazing grill chicken sandwich, and two boba milk teas. The potato scramble and tornado fries were decent. The sandwich was good but messy. A waffle as a bun is not designed to handle the weight of the chicken patty. It was a disaster to eat.  The boba milk teas were probably the most disappointing. The boba tasted old and practically fell apart the moment they hit your mouth. The tea tasted off. Definitely not what you expect when you order boba milk tea.  Not to mention that for the price ($27 for two people), you should get what you expect. My son and I literally drank three sips of our tea and threw it away.  Will not be going back.

kh7iZ34F1kosENAfibgqvA.text: The staff was lovely. The restaurant was clean. Just my food was terrible. My husbands food was terrible and if you only actually make one thing, it better be the best damn waffle I have ever tasted. Disappointed I won't be back.

zleOt7cTczpQ1vCwaBWu_g.text: Very great customer service I live in LA no bs I love waffles so much to the point where I'd make it my duty to drive to waffles cafe to get some waffles maybe a lil over exaggerating but it was fire hands down.

1YliOl1keN6eEGKadn9Qqw.text: I absolutely love this place. They offer stamp cards and for every item you purchase you receive a stamp for it, I believe I'm on my fourth one now because I love coming here for breakfast. Their ultimate bowl is probably one of my favorite dishes to get here it's a bowl with egg, seasoned potatoes, cheese, and bits of bacon. Their banana split waffle is another favorite of mine, I mean who wouldn't love ice cream for breakfast? This dish consists of a regular waffle topped with vanilla ice cream, sliced bananas, whipped cream, sprinkles, and drizzled hot fudge. I mainly come here for the boba because this is the closest and best boba place in North Las Vegas. My two favorite flavors are their taro and chocolate banana smoothies with boba. The staff is friendly as well and provide great service to the customers always.

OXa3F1boiLWFgvNy703gdQ.text: Excellent staff, but I don't get the raving reviews on food. For example, Tropic Thunder waffle... Menu says its waffle with fresh mango, peach, pineapple on top, but it was actually fruit cocktail in syrup. Fresh out of a can maybe.

xILT9sGUMoPqfxvZtPgT4w.text: We got their blazen grilled chicken and chicken and waffle meals. They were very good and the strawberry butter with the chicken and waffles was amazing. The customer service was top notch. The nice woman working the register went over the whole menu layout and was eager to help and answer any questions. I would recommend to anyone. They even have a few books for children to read while you wait for your meal. Will definitely be back.

hP5RzhIRidP1iGvq-zTmMg.text: Excellent breakfast sandwich the secret sauce is a good addition. Slightly sweet and salty was a great way to start the day. It's a large amount of food go hungry or split one with your pal.

IDnOXIf3MNj3qFZxod273g.text: I was told by my roommate that this was a great spot around the corner from our house.... I was extremely disappointed. Never seen so many people on such a short cooking line take 30 minutes to make a scrabble and a waffle with only 1 order for a party of 5 ahead of us... multi tasking is not this staffs strong point. My biggest issue was the only flavors I could describe was burnt sausage and bacon. I would go into further details but not really into writing a book so I will just end with finding any other option would be the best alternative... Carl's Jr. Across the street perhaps.

j3CtMLhekRG09YcH4yBS9Q.text: Stopped in for brunch. Chicken and Waffles, Turkey Club, Blazing Chicken, the Cherry Blossom were on the ticket and they all certainly satisfied! Waffle cut fries were excellent and the tornado fries will be tried the next time out- All menu items were under $10- Staff very cheery and helpful. Absolutely no complaints or issues with this strip mall eatery.

sjkWxCeVpK-DJboXlWGwTw.text: Tried Waffles Cafe today and here are the initial impressions. The menu is a little overpriced, but could become a better value if the price of the entree at least included a beverage (coffee). The waffles we received were thin (not Belgian style) leading to my opinion about the price. The decor was very plain and the cafe just didn't feel like something you'd experience in Aliante. This review isn't all "bad" (the waffles were good), but with a little more effort, this place could become a gem and a place we'd want to choose over competitors such as The Original Pancake House (which I'd personally give 5 stars). Lastly- the staff were friendly and welcoming so they had that going for them.

GL9jzaQv_oTDzkoZe7upBg.text: Love this place! It's simple. It's priced fair and the waffle was very good. Sunday was my day to say I have had enough of the twigs and berries and I want pancakes! Well at least a waffle although they have big banner that states now serving pancakes but really who goes to a Waffle Cafe for pancakes...the name tells you what their specialty is.   Anyway I had a waffle with blueberries, strawberries and bananas. No I passed on the chocolate chips, whipped cream and powdered sugar. Hey I was breaking lose on my food choices but didn't want to go crazy...maybe that why I was carving ribs later that night because I knew I had saved some food karma points :)  Also the staff in this place was very friendly, helpful and fun. It was good to hear youthful energy enjoying their work instead of the normal this is just my job type of employee's. This staff gave good service and enjoyed what they do.    I would definitely come back here good food, good service and fair prices. Oh and I forgot to mention they also have cool smoothies I got the Lychee...yum I love the fruit!

DvbCGXK0foVChHir3nAtJQ.text: My dad (84) and I went in yesterday for breakfast.  As we found out on a prior visit, Kim will accommodate special requests that aren't on the menu.  My dad had a tall stack of pancakes and I had the seasoned potatoes and regular sized yogurt parfait which was full of a variety of fresh fruit, granola, and yogurt.  Everything was delicious!! Kim is patient, friendly, and more than willing to answer questions.  The food is cooked after you order, and it is made with fresh ingredients.  You order at the counter, but your food and drinks are brought to your table. Kim and another person checked on us, refilled our drinks, and cleared away out plates.  So far, I have tried something new on each visit, and I have never been disappointed.  The food is hot and delicious or cold and delicious depending on what you order.  Customers are treated like they are the most important person in the place.  Everyone is friendly and helpful.  Customer service is definitely a priority.  I will definitely be back!

4UsWjxjoebI1h1eC5uGERQ.text: We've been coming here for a while now and it seems that every time we come it gets better and better. The environment is always welcoming, the food is never disappointing. I enjoy bringing my out of town friends here because I know it is worth it. Hott coffee and fruit infused water is always plentiful at the drink station. Floors are just as clean as the tables. I will visit this restaurant again and again. A++++

So we were pleasantly surprised to find Waffles Cafe and we both enjoyed their light crispy waffles. The service is awesome. A friendly smile and pleasant hello does wonders in the morning before my brain is kick started by a cup of coffee. Everything is cooked to order. Tasty. An overall delicious breakfast joint.

jPYdZJfrl3cF669YF73PmA.text: This is a pretty cool idea for a restaurant. Different and delicious! I had the s'mores waffle and it was really good. The only think is you pay for the waffle and that's it. I'd like it if they already had premade combo meals. Maybe I missed it but I like how things are set together.    I will go back for sure! Az3quPiBcCKJfuOSpDfqXQ.text: Leslie Knope would be proud of this place. Waffles Cafe is a wonderful little place for those who are in need of a sugar rush or a filling meal. I prefer the former, in which I order something with a ton of whipped cream, pie filling, ice cream, or something of that matter. At my most recent visit, I ordered the cherry blossom. Ultra sweet, just like those who work there. This place is a gem up in Aliante, and I recommend going if you want to chill out, talk with friends, and have a good waffle.

cwRRlgI7lqVuoF8bIkkDYQ.text: The cafe is small but pretty clean. We had issues with the iPad type payment system and ended up paying cash when our credit card payment wouldn't produce a receipt twice. I tried to order a boba tea as an upgrade to my breakfast order but I was told by the cashier I couldn't do that, though the menu on the wall states it's possible. The food is served on paper plates with plastic utensils brought out by the staff calling your name from your receipt. The bacon I received was rather crispy, almost burnt but the eggs were fluffy and delicious. The waffles were crispy and tasty and they offer a variety of warm syrup. The orange juice was rather sweet but good. All in all, we enjoyed our experience and will be back.

HJaxcjQRZ6tezxbmKv0ZeA.text: Loved the chicken waffle sandwich with house sauce, delicious, and best waffle fries hands down. Waffles were perfectly cooked.  Kim was great explaining their menu since it was our first time. We can't wait to go back for more.

1ExcjTNBsY-YyXXCNT3dZQ.text: This is the worst place I've ever been to whether for breakfast ore brunch, and they have alot of nerve accepting money from anyone. The waffle pizza is soggy, things are quickly heated so they're cold and cheese doesn't appear to new real cheese, the eggs like rubber, the bacon was paper thin and precooked then reheated, so disgusting, then they serve all that disgust on the cheapest paper plates, not even matching our of good quality, everything soaks right through and years before you cam finish the junk they serve you, and to pay top dollar to get your own food, please. u6RD6L01Tmx2ZrFAvlnvSQ.text: You people are crybabies. This place is more like a Carl's Jr. where you order at the register and the food is brought out to you. Ordered a waffle with strawberries, blueberries and chocolate chips with a side of eggs, bacon and a hash brown. Food was good and came out quick. Staff greeted us the moment we walked through the door. Yes I had to get my own coffee, but come on, some consider that an inconvenience? PTZLAU2cDo-UvjUDpetahw.text: Our food was good, but the service was not. My husband ordered a pumpkin delight combo, but was given just a pumpkin waffle due to the cashier not knowing how to ring it up properly. When we brought it to their attention, the cook came from the back and stated that we could have the additional toppings after they ring it up. My husband clearly stated he wanted the pumpkin delight waffle and wasn't given what he had ordered. Then they want to charge us extra for the toppings?! For a place that states 'great service' on their business cards, that's not quite 'great service.' On top of that, they gave me the wrong type of bacon. I repeated myself twice to the cashier and they still got it wrong when it came out. In the end, they gave us a full stamp card, which gives us $5 off our next visit, but i would have preferred that the cook to have apologized and given my husband what he ordered. The only person that apologized was the cashier and she stated it was her first day. Under good management, the manger, who seemed to be the cook from the back, should have apologized when she came out and corrected the order at no cost. The new cashier should not have to feel bad for making a mistake and shouldn't have to use her being a new cashier as an excuse. It clearly shows that management does not fully train their employees. This would have been a good training opportunity for the new cashier and manager. If you have a new employee who does something incorrectly, own up to the mistake, apologize, and correct it. Then address the issue after the correction has been made by going over it with your new employee.   My husband and i like the food enough that we will be returning. We just hope management trains their employees well enough so next visit is smoother.

MQVajZ2mWFMhjlSnSfVbVQ.text: Omg, the waffles here are so good! I had the chicken and waffles with strawberry butter and strawberry syrup. qTSlrXFJvrK4ngnmBSsh2w.text: I think I'm due for an update. I've been here many, many times in the past year and service has always been great. Ambiance has definitely improved. They added music! Yay! Regular menu items seem a bit pricey so catch them on their Happy Hour, Everyday 2-6 PM. BOGO 50% off Smoothies (Boba Add'l), Waffle Sandwich & Kettle Chips for $5 and Milk or Thai Tea (Buy 2 Get One Free).  Everything is worth trying. I've had Chicken & Waffles, Waffles with Strawberry & Banana with Chocolate Sauce, Ham and Pineapple Waffle Pizza, Green Tea and Banana Smoothies, Oreo Shakes, Tornado Fries, etc. They were all delicious!  Their waffles are so crunchy and fluffy at the same time. I'm so used to being served soggy waffles so it's a treat coming here.  I've seen reviews critiquing them serving on paper plates and such. I don't find it tacky or anything. There's nothing wrong with that, in my opinion. It doesn't take away from the food being yummy. Just a thought.

TPNmrJwknv31YjN2DYnmNw.text: This was my first time and although the lady walking arounddidn't talk to us and she did the other customers in the restaurant, the food was great. Small but quiet and clean... The young man behind the counter was an absolute sweetheart. The waffles were really good. I'm going to bring the kids back here to try....

4uMmR4hOzxgQfHZqgpH0sA.text: Oh Waffles Cafe, I really wanted you to be amazing but I left disappointed, only eating a few bites of my meals that I paid over $20 for. I literally left the food to go eat somewhere else. I was super excited to eat here too because there have been some many five star reviews. I'm leaving two stars because the restaurant was clean and the staff was kind but I was not a fan of my meal at all.   When we walked in we were greeted warmly and I was getting hungry right away. The restaurant is a cute little mom & pop type business with 15 or so table tops and a smaller breakfast bar against the window. The first odd thing I noticed when I walked in was that even after being greeted by the staff behind the counter I wasn't sure if I should seat myself, wait to be seated, or walk to the counter and order.   I could go down the road of pointing out the things I didn't like about our meal, but instead I feel that some constructive criticism might be helpful:   1. The menu is laid out funk and it was hard for me to follow along. It took me a few minutes to figure out what in the heck was going on. I like the idea that you can build your own waffle but making toppings all different prices had me scratching my head. I had no idea what I was spending.....just blindly ordering and I wasn't a fan.   2. The fruit in the fresh fruit did not taste fresh. Mostly it was the bananas that stood out to me. An old banana has a very distinct taste, and I wasn't excited about it. At first glance it looked amazing, but I couldn't say the same after I tasted it. The fruit wasn't cut into nice pieces, it was chopped into lots of smaller pieces that seemed odd. Lets call it more like a diced fruit bowl.   3. We received our meal at different times. First the waffle, then the fruit, then our drinks, then the food they forgot we ordered. By the time all of the food had been delivered on paper plates and bowels I just wanted to leave and did. There were two other customers in the restaurant at the same time as us and they too were asking for the missing items they had ordered.  4. I didn't enjoy the flavor of the waffle batter. It was almost tasted like a sourdough waffle. If you're a fan of sourdough, and I know there are lot of people who are, you may have enjoyed it. For me, it didn't taste at all like my grandmothers waffles on Sunday mornings, and thats the flavor I'm looking for!

iHsEeJUGin023CvtrzO1Sg.text: We go here every Sunday after church & Kimmie & her wonderful crew treat us like family. Amazing food Amazing prices and wonderful hospitality. A must for the waffles enthusiast.

rwBAi0HI2Kt4AYJf95RK2g.text: After being referred to  Waffles cafe by an employee from an adjacent business, I gave the place a try. Boy am i glad we did. The customer service was attentive and helped with the menu items. The place was clean and well staffed.  We ordered the chicken and waffles and the tropic thunder plate.  The best waffle I've ever had. It was light and fluffy and mines came with a strawberry butter, no need for syrup.  However, I used syrup on the waffles anyway. I will come back and order a la carte and make my meal more health conscious. I real breakfast treat.

Am14SbQiSgWVuwYDmRns9A.text: I was a little apprehensive to trying this out but im so glad I did. Its a quiet, bright, & warm Saturday morning. Kim greeted me pleasantly as I walked through the door and asked if this was my first visit. She offered to walk me through the menu and gave me a few minutes to make a selection.   I ordered the blazing chicken & waffle w/ hash browns & an orange smoothie. About 8 minutes later it was in front of me and it was delicious. The waffle was soft (making for a good wrap), the tomatoes and lettuce tastes fresh, and the chicken didn't disappoint either. Overall I think the best description would be fresh & vibrant.  Onto the atmosphere. As stated, Kim was extremely pleasant. The dining room is a mix between a small-ish brunch spot (as youd expect) with some hints of a 50s diner. Theres a flatscreen TV on the wall that was tuned into smooth hits of the 60s, 70s, and 80s that fit well with the mood of the place.  Definitely looking forward to coming back here sometime and trying some of the other interesting menu items.

Vi0cyG1PCephGdMihkI2vg.text: Very reasonable prices and the food here is insanely good. I highly recommend the blazing chicken sandwich the sauce is very good. Also their flax seed waffles are delicious. I would definitely drive out of my way for this one.

OnNC8r2TrMl5BwAXSKhYmg.text: This little waffle shop is a significant value, in my humble opinion.  Today, myself and the little eater known in reviews as "the wife" gave this place a shot, and they impressed.  As is my "keep it cheap" custom, I went directly after the waffle special advertised outside the restaurant.  For $5.49, the diner gets a waffle, an egg made to order, bacon or sausage, and unlimited coffee!!! The coffee is self-serve, with flavored creamers, as well as the creamy creamers.  The waffle was served hot and fresh. It had a slight buttermilk taste to it, but I may be wrong about that.  I upgraded, and added fresh blueberries for $0.75 more.    Other items on the menu include waffle sandwiches, waffle pizza's, smoothies, specialty teas, iced cream shakes, latte's, hot chocolate, soda, and juices.  Another big plus is free WiFi to customers.    If you like to be waited on, this is not your place.  The customer orders their meal at the counter, but the staff brings it to the table.  After that, you get your own coffee.  I'm happy to get the exercise of walking back and forth to the coffee, cream and Splenda.

l-jjl8Ro3djBiGioe3vv6w.text: If you are looking for fancy plates, forks and cups this is not the place of you. But if you are looking for simplicity this is the place. I had an Original waffle with banana, strawberries, nutella and whipped cream along with a mocha latte. Both were really delicious. My daughter had the cherry blossom waffle with a cup of hot cocoa also delicious. The service is stellar which made my visit even that much more worth while.

zmDQet84Cm-5MVPLpHSkFw.text: Having passed by here often we finally decided to give it a try. We went in on a weekend very early morning. There weren't many people there at the time, but the crowd picked up after that. So the menu is much more extensive thanks I was expecting. We always go for classics when trying out a new place, so that what we ordered. The waffle was good, but not anything to really write home about. It too a while to come out and they wee served on disposable plates and plastic ware. Not a huge deal, but I guess I had higher expectations from a place called waffles cafe. So, not horrible, just not sure if ilk be running back for more anytime. If you've had and enjoy blueberry hill waffles you will more than likely be dissatisfied.  It's a cute place and they seem to have a nice following, so try it and see what you think. Maybe the waffle with lots of toppings are better.

KVPAefqETSswwBKjg6P6pA.text: Wow just reading some of the other reviews just now and they seem harsh but hey I guess that;s their experience.  My aunt and I go about once a month when we get a hankering for a waffle (when you are constantly one a diet and trying to lose weight you have to splurge a little:) and the waffles we get are quite good.  We both just go old school and get the classic waffle with some fruit on it and that's about it but the price is reasonable and they always seem done and have a nice crunch to it.  The wait time can be a little long especially for not a busy place but I think they keep just one or two people on as staff and that could make the wait time a bit slow.  Overall I think its a yummy neighborhood spot.

FXOSP2LA6yQ3BerhmR-SOQ.text: Went here not long ago and it was absolutely amazing! Love it so much and am constantly recommending it for breakfast on a daily basis. The staff are wonderful and the food itself to die for!

djeiIKpSKm0_SYyL6jj5sQ.text: Just didn't do it for me the customer service was good but food was so-so. The waffle was a little cold and they serve food on paper plates. It tasted like McDonald's waffles. It is plain and simple the food was not worth coming in for. If it had been served on fine china it still would have been cold and not very tasty. Just because the staff is nice that does not increase the quality of the dish. Better off going to IHOP. Damn I wish there was a Waffle House or roscoes chicken and waffles in north Las Vegas.

HwkyAb4fLgiWCdzsv5pF4A.text: My husband and I were looking for a different place to eat breakfast. We saw a man across the street with a sign for this cafe. We walked in and noticed that this place was not at all efficient in their service. They have one cashier and not a big enough space to stand in line. We waited over 35 minutes for 2 waffle breakfast sandwiches. It was ridiculous. We brought it up to the manager and he told us that 30 minutes was the average wait time. That should not be acceptable. Each sandwich was $7 and the description said it was loaded with egg, cheese , ham and bacon. Yet another disappointment. It had one flat egg, 2 small pieces of bacon, a small sliver of ham and small amount of cheese. Overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone; unless you enjoy overpriced waffles and a very long wait for food.

DPZf7Ao2nZaZ5OMWOLR8Xg.text: I think, what's really attracted me to this place, is the fact of them having strawberry smoothie with boba and adding protein. That, plus its just a few miles away from home. Way better, then driving to Chinatown, and finding a place that will add protein to a strawberry smoothie with boba.   I found this place, to be unique, cause I rarely see anything like it. I'm sure there are others out there, but I haven't been living in Vegas that long to experience what locals experience. I guess you can say I'm still trying to find my way around Vegas. Just so happen, that we found our way to Waffles Cafe in Aliante.   First time around, I tried their Smore's Waffle, which was different, and sweet. I'm a bit marshmallow fan, that I had to try it and see. It wasn't to bad, but kind of sweet for breakfast. Second time around, I tried their Pepperoni Pizza Waffle. Which may sound odd or the sound of it, may make you wonder, how it taste. But quite honestly, it wasn't as bad as I thought. The fact, that I like pizza, is great, but the fact of it being on a waffle, made it interesting. I guess you can say, its a pizza, with a really soft crust.   The staff, was very nice, and made sure that everything was okay. But, the staff only consist of two Asian ladies. The place itself, look very nice and clean. Knowing that its fairly new, business there, seems really slow and when we usually go, its like 0-3 other people are in there. The only thing I'm not satisfied with, is the pricing. Even though its good, from my point of view, I don't think the pricing fits it, that well. I'm sure business would probably be better if it was probably a dollar cheaper.   I would probably say, if your into trying something unique and different, you should try it. I would definitely do the smoothie. I prefer boba with protein, but I'll leave that up to you. Again, the pricing is a bit more then expected, but its worth trying.

2IVRq1-odwZF6NqLD4RXwg.text: The ultimate breakfast bowl is delicious!  Quiet atmosphere for a Sunday morning breakfast.  My best friend & I love coming to this little place

5zDKrcSJ_kxzFNQ3-_y0Jg.text: This place is super cute. The servers are very sweet and friendly. Like another yelper state, it is not a restaurant. You place your order at the register, seat yourself and they bring your food out. I always get the breakfast combo, which is very reasonably priced for what you get. Portion size is just right, not huge and just enough. I feel as if the waffles are a bit in the salty side, which is probably because the same batter makes both the sweet and savory waffles. Also, try their smoothies.  Huge selection of flavors.

Y3IJuUZ6GShw4w48bGBd7A.text: Great little cafe! It wasn't what I expected when I walked through the door, but the customer service is awesome and the food is great! Prices were reasonable too!

6fpOXDk2Kp0JeawSpWKxrg.text: This easily became one of my favorite places in Vegas!  Came here for the fittest time a year ago; now that I'm moving here, plan on at least once a week.  A must try.  Super friendly service, great selection, great food at great prices.  Can't wait for the next time.

k4jujGjh4ogFKSq1_kprRg.text: pretty awesome relaxing and interesting little cafe, they let you make your own type of waffle, from protein, red velvet, fruity, or original. Best part are the potatoes! haha try it out! awesome place

-yCwZ7O7fXMuC-oqxm2E_A.text: I've seen some mixed reviews about this place and being how I am, I have to go see for myself. We thought we'd stop by on our way to running some errands and give it a shot. The place is pretty small so you want to get there at a good time so you can actually get a seat. The line can get long at times. We ordered our food and found a seat. It took a long time for us to even get our food. It felt like people who came in after us, were getting their food before us and we only had two in our party. Definitely wasn't happy about waiting as long as we did for our food. I got the chicken and waffle plate and he got the ice cream sundae waffle. They were both good, but I don't think they were super. I will say the strawberry butter that they give you for the chicken and waffle didn't go very well. I'm glad I only put it on half of my waffle. I won't do that again. The sundae waffle was good too, but it was super sweet to eat for breakfast. We may go back and try it again, trying something different on their menu.

JWFlNwvRbvMpeev2P5LneQ.text: It was okay.Because I was super hungry.But looks n sounds like they just used microwave for warm up.also I don't like the paper plate... Table was sticky. Good point was syrup was in warmer place. I think price is little bit pricy for this quality... And that's all.

_qdBXMn17kpFcMDDklxDWg.text: It's a decent spot to get breakfast type foods. I made a take-away order this last Saturday.  Waffle - Strawberry/Nutella: Nutella was not used, it seemed more like a chocolate syrup. Potato Scramble: Enjoyed it, was pretty good. Tornado Fries (Flame Grill BBQ): I can't really comment on this one because when I got home, they hadn't packed it with the rest of the food. FHYl84NTojJpRDkrlUjBEw.text: Good smoothies. Even better waffles. Their blazing chicken and waffles are great. Can take a little long to get everything, but good food can take time!

aAv2ky-F-oHmp_8waQAq_g.text: This was a yelp find and it was pretty decent. I do wish that we decided to go in verses getting out meal to go. The inside is cozy and full of character. I loved how their menu was very large and visible, they also had a smaller specials menu that had drink specials for the day. I originally was going to order online but had issues with that set up and ultimately had to call in and go pick up, which was my only thing I didn't care for. But customer service was nice and helpful, I'm super pregnant and the lady asked me multiple times if she could help me out to my car, but I like the activities so I just made the extra trips. As far as taste goes, waffles are fluffy and have a nice texture to them. They have no flavor on their own, which is usual, but it makes up for that with their topping choices! I was not able to taste the pancake that my son got but from his 9 year old mouth "it was like dessert and pancake deliciousness , it was like a party!" We also got bacon and hash browns which aren't too special. Definitely give it a try if you have a sweet tooth and are looking for a fun breakfast, but also if you just want breakfast, because they have plenty of other savory options!

AufORSeD7pN-U__7dOZsxA.text: I had a strawberry wheatgrass smoothie.. I forgot to add boba, but it's the best consistency for on the go. Amazing waffles and chicken. Fluffiest pancakes I've had in forever

3dU6aylFwgB_7aB1TdgQrA.text: We won't ever be back. We had to wait 10mins for coffee, the food was mediocre and cold, and the place was dirty. We sat at the table outside the kitchen, and saw the cooks place plates of cooked food under the fryer while they waited for food staff to pick them up; no hot plates or anywhere clean. Oq1VEGqtQi1PE53Lu7E3Rw.text: This place is phenomenal from the food to the drinks to the smoothies to the atmosphere to the music to the friendly workers to the owners themselves I had to get his place 10 out of 10 it is perfect it needs nothing else to be a great place it is beyond perfect I will definitely be going here again I love this place the food is awesome very very very awesome and the drinks are awesome as well I know I said that already but what can I say when something is good do you have to explain it the best you can I will be coming again and again.

It's posted by the register that they use the best ingredients so I was excited in tasting my waffle order.    To my disappointment, the waffles tasted terrible without whip cream and syrup.  The batter quality is substandard; thin, tasteless, cardboard-flavor.  I gave it another shot by dunking this waffle into my Starbucks coffee but it's unpalatable to me.  I shredded them into pieces and used it as bird food; They seemed to enjoy it!  What a waste of my $5.  Next time I'll invest this money into a breakfast buffet giving me assortment of waffles, pancakes and the likes. wQrzTrxLf_0XenTJr3Pe9g.text: The people were great. The food was good  Actually more filling then I thought. Small place so be willing to take to go. The kid portions were big enough for two kids or one adult. Love a family business.

g1MrcP-zSEh_XfvzL7kU3A.text: Super yummy! The staff was super friendly and the restaurant was very clean and low key. We walked in and were asked if we have dined here before, after saying no the employee asked if we needed her to go over the menus. I thought this was very nice considering all of the staff being younger and really caring about our experience. We ordered and sat where we wanted. Upon sitting the owner was in the back and greeted many who walked in. We didn't wait too long for our meal and everything was fresh. We ordered an orange smoothie and a cantaloupe bona smoothie super refreshing! Chicken and waffles along with a red velvet waffle. The chicken tenders on the waffle was absolutely scrumptious. All white meat, i didnt have to dissect through any of the meat which I tend to do because im extremely picky with my white meat. Comes with a blazing sauce which isn't too spicy, your choice of maple syrup (flavored, plain or sugar free) and a wonderful strawberry butter on top DIVINE. The red velvet pancake didnt really burst with red velvet flavor for me. It was topped with whipped cream, powdered sugar and a sweet glaze on top and on the side should you require more. It was  a sweet treat to end out chicken and waffles brunch item. My husband loved the red velvet, I on the other hand was just ok with it, but it wasn't bad, just super sweet and he picked the item so i wont take any stars for that because its a personal preference really. Just know its very sweet, if you love that then try it! The price point in super affordable compared to actual Diners. $8.50 for the chicken and waffles and $4.50 for the red velvet. Smoothies range based on size and if you want boba beads or other toppings $3.99-5.99-ish. They offer happy hour specials after 2pm on the drinks buy one get one 50% off SWEET! I totally would come back and recommend anyone to give this place a try. Oh the owner also came over to our table to check on everything, nice touch!

zkK7HI41hdDHxgiLmCozMg.text: This was our first time even hearing of Waffles Cafe, my husband had wanted to go to Cracker Barrel and then I found this and talked him into to trying it. This is the best breakfast place I've ever been too! I love their menu giving you options between a set waffle or a build your own. We both built our own and I am so glad we did. They were delicious!! We both got a flavored waffle with fruit. The fruit is so fresh and sweet you don't want to douse it in syrup. The waffles aren't cloyingly sweet, even the red velvet with cream cheese drizzle, and are the perfect size to be pleasantly filling. Their sides are so yummy too! The potatoes are crispy and well seasoned and their grits are delicious! The staff is so sweet too! As soon as you walk in you are welcomed from every staff member and then asked if it's your first time or greeted by name if not. They walk you through the menu and find out exactly what you want. Then when your food is ready the cutest, sweetest woman comes out with it and asks what else she can bring, a selection of warm syrups, butter, ketchup, hot sauce you name it!  My husband and I loved the restaurant and unless they build one in St George Ut we will definitely be back!!

BGdBDREeL8ZLY6IaSTbLRg.text: One of my favorite places to grab a bite! Their waffle sandwich is absolutely delicious and so filling. Not to mention their prices are amazing! But what makes this place worth the 5 stars is their customer service. The younger guy who works there is so nice and always makes my boyfriend and I feel welcome. I HIGHLY recommend this place!!!

t9cSynCFvaWXVidQrv6swg.text: After a long morning of fasting, having blood drawn, and sitting at the DMV, my husband and I were STARVING on Thursday morning, and decided to look up someplace nearby for breakfast.    Pulling up my trusty Yelp app, I located Waffles Cafe, and we decided to check it out.   Upon entering, we were greeted warmly by Kim, who I found out a little later is the owner.  She asked if we'd been in before, and after finding out that we hadn't, let us know that if we had questions about the menu, to just ask, and she's more than happy to help.    The menu is big, but not too overwhelming.  I had a hard time picking because everything looked wonderful.   We decided on:  Chicken and waffles for my fella, and the "create your own" waffle combo for me.   I've seen a couple reviews knocking the place because they use paper plates and plastic utensils, but it didn't bother me at all.  At least the plates/cups are biodegradable.    The thing is, this isn't a fancy restaurant or a chain like Ihop or Denny's.  Its super cute, super clean (like...she wipes down the hot sauce bottles after they've been used), and cozy.  I'm not so pretentious to be bothered by eating off paper plates.    I also ordered a taro boba drink, which was heavenly.  Boba was the perfect consistency.    When the food arrived, everything was HOT.  Like...I burned my mouth on the grits, hot.    Fella's chicken and waffles were good.  We're 99% sure that the chicken is breaded in house and not store bought.  They were tasty.  Not greasy at ALL, which thrilled me.   The chicken came with this sauce...we think its a honey mustard type base with hot sauce, and it is DELICIOUS.  I'd eat this all day long.  Fella's waffle was really good too.    I opted for the "create your own" waffle combo.  This is exciting, because there are at least 5 or 6 different waffle bases for you to choose from: Original, Gluten free, Red Velvet, Chia Seed, Flax seed...SO many to choose from!   For Thursday's visit, I chose the original batter, with pecans.  (there were LOTS of other toppings, but I was in the mood for simple)  The combo comes with 2 sides and a drink.  I chose bacon, grits, and did my boba slushie, with an upgrade charge.    So the waffle itself comes with powdered sugar and whipped cream.  We had regular syrup too.  The waffle was really good.  Crunchy on the outside, moist on the inside...perfect.    The grits were burn your mouth hot, but delicious.  Best grits I've had in ages, truth be told.  Throw in a little butter (which it came with on the side)...mmmm.  I was in heaven.  The bacon was cooked well.  I wish there was more than 2 pieces to a side, but I think that's pretty standard for "sides" of bacon at other places too.  Who doesn't want more bacon all the time anyway?    We were checked on a couple of times, but not too many.  Service really was top notch.    I definitely plan to return, there are lots of items on the menu that I want to try out!!

SG7gHcDDUDPRtrWapZhW1w.text: Came here for brunch while visiting here in Vegas. I was so happy walking in to see quite the crowd but we were still able to be sat immediately. We walked to the counter to be greeted by a friendly face who was more than happy to answer questions since it was our first time there. My boyfriend and I both got Waffle Combos. I got a chocolate chip waffle, grits with butter and scrambled eggs. To drink I got a hot chai latte.  The waffle was absolutely delicious and as someone who doesn't typically have a sweet tooth, I ate that waffle so quickly because of how good it was. The eggs were cooked perfectly and I devoured the eggs and as for the grits, delicious and buttery. The chai latte was a perfect and delicious classic that went super well with my breakfast. My boyfriend got an iced vanilla latte and honestly, it was probably some of the best coffee I've ever tasted.  True home-cooked meals and it shows in the taste and quality. The staff was so nice and welcoming and they laughed with us. The atmosphere is warm and homey and I was just really quite happy we stumbled across this place.  My boyfriend and I decided every time we come visit vegas, we'll make it a point to come here for brunch!  Highly recommend!

ctun-g09RB7R2TWLjHLccQ.text: We found Waffles Cafe on Yelp and we really enjoyed breakfast. Variety of signature waffles and on make your own.  Good service and nice and friendly staff.

lS6oIgUAt_fgRfDswJCpgw.text: The waffles themselvea were good. I just didnt expect it to be on a paper plate.   Prices reasonable. Atmosphere lacking something .. Maybe re arrange the seating.  Then manager was all in our business. Why i dont know but not professional at all.

They were in the kitchen with the staff working just as hard(which is True leadership). The food, oh my, was awesome. Daughter had red velvet yummo! I had gluten free yummo! The grits were exellent! RWK7RzbwfIF6RqcMN47iJA.text: Very disappointed in wait time and service. 25 minutes for two minimal waffles, tukey bacon and turkey sausage.   As we were short on time already, we requested it to go. However, once we left the facility, upon opening the bag, we saw they never actually gave us the turkey bacon. In addition, the turkey sausage was very pitiful and small.   Heading to the other Waffle Cafe on Durango right now. The better one.

lfuh9j7fnHCFsseb97zk6g.text: First time experience was delicious. I ordered chicken and waffle and it was such a nice combo. Love the strawberry whipped butter with the spicy sauce! The chicken taste ok but wish it was more tender and juicy. Waffles were perfect. Went back another time and tried to order the same thing for dinner but they ran out of chicken. Went back 3rd day but they were already closed so I suggest getting meat entree early in the day. Would be nice if they extended their hours in the evening . I thought the prices were a little high tho.

kl3uS75rrb0uoKSXfWPJkQ.text: great customer service  one time i ordered something but didn't know it can a large portion because of how the have it set up like i said i wanted 4 eggs and the girl said ok , when i revived it it was 4  orders of 2 eggs each  i was like huh? she explained that how it comes i didn't want that many so and before i left i ordered a drink and she comped it for me so that was nice of her . i think i've tried everything on the menu once , the food is great but sometimes if i order the wings they smell a little bad like a old gamey smell once in a while . but other than that the food is great

3SaEAADYXvTZNBCYkLuBXA.text: Every time I walk in I'm greeted with a "hello" from the staff and when I leave with "goodbye and thank you." This is always appreciated. The oatmeal is to die for!!!! qbadLqvemw1n6PJD1bdRMQ.text: Waffles were pretty darn amazing!  They have unique flavors like pumpkin and red velvet.  The woman behind the counter had amazing customer service! Smiling and enthusiastic.  It was my first time there and she explained how the menu worked.  Considering they have so many options, it loved her explanation of the waffles and what types of combos you can get.  Pumpkin waffle with nutella, coconut and bananas were amazing.  Oreo milkshake could have had a little more oreo in it.  Overall, one waffle with toppings was extremely filling!  A little steep on the prices....but good breakfast!

tWCxq3eDx6AAO84CFccsaA.text: I ordered the breakfast waffle sandwich, which has egg, cheese, ham, and bacon. It was also served with chips.   The food was good, but the wait before we got our food was so long! There was only one other group of 2 people waiting for their food in the restaurant, and it took 25 minutes before we got ours!   I give three stars because the food was good (not good enough for me to want to return), but we waited so much longer than we should have for our order that it's not worth it.

I had a soda instead of coffee so I don't know how that is yet.   They have a punch card as well so don't forget to ask about that. After so many punches you get a free meal.

fO8ii7CMGeDz2ZFFpVuUlQ.text: Paper plates. Plastic utencils. Cafeteria style. Not a cafe ... more like ...   You ever go to a motel and get the "breakfast buffet" where you make your own waffles? Yeah, like that. You can convince yourself your getting a bargin, but you know its not a real meal. And plastic forks for waffles? Yeah. Not a great combo for the customer.    Food has weird (though, not bad) aftertaste -- at first it was delicious, but after a few bites, I was like ... huh? What is that? Slightly turned butter? Flax seed oil? Whatever it was, I wasn't into it.   THe eggs were plentiful, but, tasted like they were made with water and not milk.   Coffee, the coffee was just bad.   A couple of lights burned out. My chair was wobbily.   Service was like a Subway or McDonalds, except they bring the food out to you. Otherwise, similar.

9qTNdRjYu-eL4Kux0f5Azg.text: This place has easily become one of my new favorites. A hidden gem in the Northwest area. It's always very clean. I have never walked in and saw even a dirty table. The owner is cheerful and very sweet to each and every customer. She even remembered my name. Which isn't an easy one . The entire staff is super friendly to be honest and still very professional. I like that. The atmosphere is relaxed like a coffee shop but with a sweet smell always in the air that screams southern home-cooked breakfast.  So far my favorites are the red velvet waffle and the chicken wings. The wings are actual seasoned perfectly and taste home cooked. My husband is a bacon-freak so he loves the "Kimmie's BLT Xplosion" it's loaded with bacon. My kids like the "tornado fries" Definitely check this place out!!! Good customer service + Good food. Oh and they have a selection of unique waffle batters including some healthy ones too! Enjoy!!!

hBy6iaPr0M_VCFGqKeYh2g.text: Food was good! Presentation simple. You order and pay when you enter and the food is brought to you. So the tip is a bit tricky as you would be tipping before experiencing any service. Quality was good. I suppose you have to save somewhere so having all the food on paper plates was a bit of a surprise (slight disappointment). Still I'll be back. Very friendly staff. +1 for being a family owned business.

rCtRIUX1u76aLexxirfSpQ.text: The BEST waffles in Vegas! We stopped in for the first time today - and were quickly greeted by a nice hostess. The restaurant is set up For quick service, you order at a counter and the bring it out to you. The inside is clean and easy to move around in if you have mobility issues. We tried the Chicken & Waffles, one with tenders and one with chicken wings. O.MG. Hands down the best chicken and waffles in Vegas. Everything is made fresh, the chicken is fresh, the fruit is yummy. I love it. A lot of places say they make all their food fresh - but you can tell when they've just thaw out a bunch of frozen chicken nuggets - this place is actually legit. They also have a coffee bar, so if you order coffee you get a to-go cup and can refill on your way out the door - great idea!

12Kq17JMC8-0QNPAi3ypwQ.text: Finally stopped in after constantly driving by it.  Was empty when I walked in so I wasn't sure what to expect. However, once I ordered and sat down, everyone started coming in. During the 45 minutes that I was there I noticed they do a lot of mobile delivery orders. I won't name them because why should I. They're not paying me. Haha.   It took me quite a while to decide because the menu descriptions along with the pictures made everything look tasty. I finally decided on a cherry blossom waffle combo with bacon and potatoes. I figured since I had just gotten over a cold, ice cream on my waffle would be beneficial to me.   The food was awesome. I was extremely upset because I could not find anything to complain about. I suppose I could say nobody would tie my shoes, but I love Vans slip-ons. I'll definitely be back. Next time though I'm going to find some shoes that tie...

9sr11Vt8-4Le8SYBEcM1tA.text: My rating is ZERO. This place should be named Waffles Cafeteria.  It is 5 steps below a public school cafeteria   It serves food on cardboard plates and uses plastic utensils. No condiments on the tables. Food wait is long even when few patrons. Food is served cold and over seasoned. It doesn't even look appetizing   The customer service probably is poor because the owner has a BAD ATTITUDE when questioned.  This place is really a self serve spot. You make your own coffee served in paper cups to go.  My idea of going out to eat is letting someone serve me and not myself, especially if they want you to tip and pay before you eat.

Xrs_p1Kl1I6vNb7zcRgOOg.text: The owner has a very bad attitude. Her calm voice and demeanor changed immediately when I asked her a question and tried to explain something to her . She got very loud and talked over me.  I noticed she graced every customers table with her syrupy sweet voice asking how the meal was but never came to our table. And it was embarrassingly noticeable when we were the only customers in the Cafe except for one other patron.  As a business owner; there is much needed customer service that she lacks. There's more to running a business than just cooking and serving food. .I wanted to tell her how the chicken was fried to our liking and that the food was great but unfortunately we never got the chance because she never came to our table...

Z2dYHFNMFhkvUzSP7RL-fA.text: We were staying at the hotel nearby and I needed to get breakfast for the family. I ordered here using grub hub. It said my food would be ready in 15 minutes so I headed over. The seating area is fair, the counter is small. The staff was friendly but way in the weeds with customers and so many mobile orders.  I was told my food needed a few more minutes, that's fine. Overall my wait was 20 minutes in the store not counting the drive over. So, 30 minutes to get a waffle, waffle sandwich and a smoothie.  Unfortunately after all that time I got back to the hotel and found that the order was wrong. I had ordered a custom pumpkin waffle with apples but got a plain waffle with syrup. My gracious daughter said it was still good, but I was upset I paid extra for the custom food I didn't get. The rest of the food was good, but because of the wait, I don't think I'd go back for breakfast at least. They have a good product and friendly staff. They might just need to hire additional help or move a little faster.

1izyhmZDlNZ7vqv2nlI_cQ.text: This is such a great little caffe! My brothers, mom, and I all had breakfast here yesterday for Mother's day and loved it. When we arrived it was around 9am so it was not too busy but as we finished ordering and sat down to wait for our food the place began filling up and got pretty busy which was a good sign our food would be good. The woman who took our order was nice and in a happy mood considering the holiday and the man who brought out our food was just as friendly. He even came back a second time to provide us syrup options that he later came back with. Cool little fancy syrup dispensers too! I got the chicken and waffles and WOW I will definitely be back that was amazing especially with the spicy buffalo sauce.

ZKP2i2lFsNMfcWyStfbGmg.text: OMG OMG this place is amazing !!!!! Stoped in for a late brunch on Sunday with my BF and my son, let me just say the customer service is FUCKING PHENOMENAL!! The young man with the gorgeous curly hair at the register was soooo helpful explaining the menu to us being that it was our first visit. And might I add he was the most professional, well mannered, polite young man I've ever come across. There whole staff was just amazing !!!  So whomever is doing the training here needs a medal and to train other businesses how to give great customer service! If you haven't tried waffles cafe you're missing out!!!! We will definitely be back!  thank you again for the incredible service and crazy delicious food!!!

mQnqZ4ZaxQ3WNEaMW2SKDA.text: Enjoying the chicken and waffle meal. The strawberry butter is divine and that blazin sauce, so yummy.  Topped with warm syrup.  I'm telling you, we will be back. Best part is that your walking distance.

NKOzugmXF3UWK5MOKNk9wg.text: The food was decent but the problem was that the chicken tenders I got weren't actually tenders. A chicken tender is technically part of the breast. The breast being made of the pectoralis major and minor. The pectoralis major is the "breast" part. The smaller section of the breast is the pectoralis minor, or the "tender". What I got wasn't that. It was a glorified chicken nugget. Processed, spongey, and all.  My tip to the establishment: don't call giant nuggets "tenders".  Other than that, the food was decent. Good luck.  Update: I finished my coffee and it was super grainy at the end. Bitter bits of grounds got me grumpy. BAD!!!

nHKuYfI49WuNKw38hGnlAQ.text: Great breakfast and brunch spot. Great for groups and children. A lot of menu items to choose from. Plenty of seating and not a long wait. Prices are affordable. Worth a drive if you're in the area. Waffle batter is tasty didn't even need syrup. Had the red velvet and created my own 3 side meal. Everything was delicious no complaints. Will be back for sure to taste rest of menu as there was a lot to choose from. Staff was friendly and attentive. Met one owner and she introduced herself and was talking with most customers. You can tell this establishment cares about their customers.

qsGgiR8zBEIVZLRAxmf-3g.text: This morning we had a wonderful breakfast.  Ordered chicken and waffle and the meat lovers scramble with potatoes.   Great homemade style breakfast.  Chicken wings were the size of raptor wings. The owners was very hospitable and we wish her the most success with the business.  Looks like she is very involved and does a great job.  Loved the strawberry butter and the homemade hot sauce.   Keep it up alliante, lots of great family businesses and I plan to support them all.

HVBiayhXnROZR5ZnRVzGew.text: This waffle joint is a half mile from Aliante Casino.  When my relatives start hitting the slots, they say I'm bad luck if I watch, so they tell me to scram."We'll be here a half hour, see you then..."  They say they kinda feel sorry for me, but they get over it, and so do I.  Why?  It gives me an excuse to head to Waffles Cafe.   Carbs rarely ever taste this good.  I love waffles, and this waffle by itself is near perfect -  light, slightly sweet, tender, and slightly crispy all at the same time.  When it comes out warm, no matter what it's topped with, it's heavenly.  This time, I opted for the peaches and strawberries.  The peaches were sliced canned cling peaches, which I like, but I loved the sliced fresh strawberries with a dollop of whipped cream in the middle.  I decided to get it to go and eat it in the parking lot of the casino, well aware the Casino videotapes the parking lots.  All I can say to the security staff watching my one tape, "Get your own!" The aromatic, juicy berrie slices were naturally sweet with the waffle, the peaches were a good contrast visually, in taste, and texture.   The variety of waffles is fantastic, you can order one of their pre made concoctions, or create your own.  There is nutella, pumpkin, pecan, apples, blueberries, and so many others.  They have a great $5.49 breakfast waffle special with egg, bacon or sausage, and can add hash browns for a price. Of course, waffle sandwhiches are popular, too.   They had some bobas and teas.  But I had their Columbian coffee to go, it was decent, though I prefer my coffees bolder (i.e. French Roast) but it was a great accompaniement to my sweet dessert.  All told, it was about $8.  Definitely, I'll come back again.  My relatives didn't win this time, but in a half hour, I was far happier and my wallet was heavier than theirs.
